sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using matrix methods
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using matrix methods: 

x + y + z = 6 

2x - 3y + 2z = -2 

3x + 2y - 4z = -10
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using matrix methods, we first write the given system in the matrix form AX = B, where A is the coefficient matrix, X is the column matrix of variables, and B is the constant matrix.

A = | 1  1  1 |      X = | x |      B = |  6  |
    | 2 -3  2 |          | y |          | -2  |
    | 3  2 -4 |          | z |          | -10 |

Now, we find the inverse of matrix A (A_inv) and multiply it with matrix B to get the solution matrix X.

A_inv = 1/det(A) * adj(A)

First, we find the determinant of A (det(A)):

det(A) = 1(-12 + 8) - 1(4 - 6) + 1(6 - 9)
det(A) = 1(-4) - 1(-2) + 1(-3)
det(A) = -4 + 2 - 3
det(A) = -5

Now, we find the adjugate of A (adj(A)):

adj(A) = | (-12 + 8)  (4 - 6)  (6 - 9)  |
             | (8 - 6)   (4 - 3)  (12 - 6) |
             | (6 - 9)   (6 - 4)  (2 - 3)  |

adj(A) = | -4  -2  -3 |
             |  2   1   6 |
             | -3   2  -1 |

Now, we find the inverse of A (A_inv):

A_inv = 1/det(A) * adj(A)
A_inv = -1/5 * | -4  -2  -3 |
                      |  2   1   6 |
                      | -3   2  -1 |

A_inv = |  4/5  2/5  3/5  |
            | -2/5 -1/5 -6/5 |
            |  3/5 -2/5  1/5  |

Now, we multiply A_inv with B to get the solution matrix X:

X = A_inv * B

X = |  4/5  2/5  3/5  | * |  6  |
      | -2/5 -1/5 -6/5 |   | -2  |
      |  3/5 -2/5  1/5  |   | -10 |

X = | (4/5 * 6) + (2/5 * -2) + (3/5 * -10) |
      | (-2/5 * 6) + (-1/5 * -2) + (-6/5 * -10) |
      | (3/5 * 6) + (-2/5 * -2) + (1/5 * -10) |

X = | 2 |
      | 1 |
      | 3 |

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is x = 2, y = 1, and z = 3.
